name: Ramada Hotel & Suites

reviews.title: Nice winter break by the river
reviews.text: This is a modern hotel, situated right on the river. Well appointed room with lovely views.
I would not hesitate in recommending the spa room.
reviews.title: Beautiful rooms

reviews.text: Very quiet and right inte centre of town.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are lovely with spa bath which open up into the room. Restaurant is great with very good coffee. Conference room was good and roomy but noise from the kitchen was distracting. Staff were all very helpful and 24 hour reception was excellent, good undercover secure parking.
reviews.title: Lovely place for a romantic getaway

reviews.text: Views are fantastic and it is close to the shopping centre.
reviews.title: Vinesh 612

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Such a great location in the main street of Ballina. The views to the river where the vista is unspoilt by development, affording glimpses of fishing vessels and other water craft, with mangroves in the distance behind. The one bedroom apartment is spacious and generous. An impressive well- appointed bathroom includes a large spa bath (which does need a certain amount of water to be operational). The over sized bedroom features a very comfortable king sized bed and ample room for your things, river views as well! The lounge/kitchen is spacious and includes all you need for a trouble free stay. Once again the river views are a welcome feature from every room and leave you with a relaxed and calm attitude as you sit and enjoy the scenery. The staff were extremely efficient and helpful, attending to requests promptly and courteously.
reviews.title: comfortable, peaceful and pristine river views

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night as we attended a Wedding in Ballina. Good room with spa overlooking the river. Modern decor and tea/coffee and toiletries included. King Size Bed was very comfortable. Restaurant & Bar onsite also pool. Indian restaurant and hair salon also in complex. My sister and I took advantage of the hair salon as we were going to the wedding. Checkout was 11am. Even though check-in was 2pm we let them know we were attending a wedding and they prepared our rooms quickly and we checked-in at 12.30.
reviews.title: Excellent Location overlooking the River

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Walking distance to shops and restaurants and the Ballina RSL Club.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, lovely room with an excellent river view and well looked after by the staff. I'll come back.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for a quiet beach retreat.

reviews.text: We didn't have a reservation and just showed up in the middle of the night. The staff was very helpful and kind. They found accommodation for us and made our check in process simple and diligent: something we really appreciated, since we were driving for hours.
reviews.title: A slice of Paradise

reviews.text: I booked 4 rooms for my family and friends, rooms were spotless and so fresh, very impressive decor aswell, we were 13 of us , from owner Peter Nair to staff they made every effort to move things around so we can all enjoy evening together over looking richmond river, the view is second to none, service is great and all staff were very professional and price is so reasonable, not overrated and over price like byron, ballina is so lucky to have ramada,General manager karen and Mr Peter Nair you guys rock, thank you for making over weekend very memorable and enjoyoble
reviews.title: Family long weekend stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed here for a night in a Hotel Spa Room to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary. We were given a great room on the 5th floor overlooking the beautiful Richmond River. We have stayed here before and noticed the positive changes in the hotel. On this occasion we were very impressed with the staff who professional, friendly and helpful in both the the front Desk and the Restaurant, which all helps to make your stay enjoyable and fun.
reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary Getaway
A great stay!
reviews.text: For a town like Ballina which has just been bypassed and some businesses are suffering it was good to see this Hotel busy and operating smoothly.
Would recommend this to both couples and families for a relaxing break in a picturesque location.
reviews.title: Business Trip. Good rooms, good location. Average customer service.

reviews.text: I booked a “Mother’s Day in May” special for $150: a river view queen room, chocolates, a bottle of bubbly, and a designer (Peter Morrissey) loofah and bath bomb.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, fabulous service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 6 nights during a month long honeymoon in Australia during January 2012, we were originally looking at Byron Bay, but 6 nights here was more than half the price of 5 nights in Byron Bay, we had a hire car so getting around wasn't a problem.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel so much!
Wonderful location great service
reviews.text: On the first night we stayed in a Spa Hotel Room which overlooked the river, within moments of arriving we were sat on the balcony watching a dolphin and a turtle, a lovely welcome. The Hotel room was spacious and the bathroom was lovely and big with a walk in shower and a jacuzzi bath. There was also a laundry room outside our apartment (shared with the neighbouring room) and this came in handy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: That evening we quickly realised that although beautiful, the town of Ballina was a little sleepy with not a massive variety of places to eat out, so we asked if we could upgrade to a 1 bedroom apartment, they allowed us to do this for something like an extra $20 per night. The apartment was AMAZING, we had a separate bedroom with a bathroom and small balcony and then had a large living area with full kitchen, dining table, sofa and large balcony overlooking the river - I would 100% recommend the apartments if you are staying more than a few nights and enjoy the flexibility of being able to cook your own meals, for us its a novelty as there are many wonderful fresh foods Australia has to offer than the UK doesn't.
reviews.title: Easy weekend away. Flawless.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels bar service, food and drink was all very pleasant and each evening at sunset we would sit outside with a drink or a coffee, and also used this time to make use of the free bar wifi to keep in touch with family back home. Highly recommend their milkshakes :)
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The immediate local area has a variety of small shops, take away food places and a few restaurants and bars, you can also walk to the big surf club where they serve meals as well. We had a car so we were able to explore some of the local areas, shopping centres, beaches and also took a day trip to Byron Bay.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, sparkling and comfortable

description: Ramada Hotel & Suites has 115 rooms consisting of hotel spa rooms, 1 and 2 bedroom suites and 2 and 3 bedroom penthouses, all with modern, stylish decor and all the facilities you would expect from an international class hotel.
